title: Shaco OP duskblade interaction ( He can proc it 2 times )

embed.description: Hey guys Youmuus here and today we are looking at a cool trick you can do with shaco that makes him proc duskblade twice. So if your wondering if shaco's clone can proc duskblade the answer is yes. More info : Shaco's clone can apply the Duskblade passive.

body: Hey guys just wanted to share this neat shaco trick / interaction for those of you who don't know this can happen. No sure if it's intented but definitely makes {{item:3147}} a strong option for shaco :) ~ {{item:3142}}

replies.body:
I don't understand why people are so surprised by this.

Shaco's clone has always applied on-hit effects.

Yeah, so far we're fine with this interaction. It will be powerful in some circumstances, so are other items on the clone however that you're giving up in exchange for this. The circumstances that maximize the power from the second Duskblake proc also potentially cost you other damage (having the clone hold off on auto attacking until the target's low), so overall average power shouldn't be too nuts in that regard either. Definitely keeping an eye on it though (and other clone like interactions with Morde, LB and Yorick too).

Interesting. I guess vs. a full health target that doesn't mean too much, plus he's not exactly at his strongest by the time he gets the item anyway. It'll be interesting to say the least. 

Plus the clone only really helps with escapes and some outplay. Damage from the clone isn't really the big goal imo. This could change that I suppose, but it's only been a few days so no telling.

Duskblade on AP Shaco?
AA->explode->Zed?

Fun thought if nothing else.
If you think its fine.....wow. You are ridiculous.

It's still Shaco.  He has to actually work to stay relevant.  Once he goes in, he's in unless nobody focuses him and he manages to Deceive away again.  Shaco isn't magically better at teamfighting and will still be the same splitpushing monster he's always been.
1v1 tho hes pretty good.
GOOOD shaco players are a dime a million, the amount of people that can capitalize on this fact is so minute (my-newt = small) that there is no reason to remove it....

> Yeah, so far we're fine with this interaction. It will be powerful in some circumstances, so are other items on the clone however that you're giving up in exchange for this. The circumstances that maximize the power from the second Duskblake proc also potentially cost you other damage (having the clone hold off on auto attacking until the target's low), so overall average power shouldn't be too nuts in that regard either. Definitely keeping an eye on it though (and other clone like interactions with Morde, LB and Yorick too).

In the same vein, when mord has a Jhin ghost, he never runs out of ammo nor gets the 4th hit. Is that intended?
Pretty sure if you get jhin ghost while jhin had fourth shot, very shot will be the critical shot

Sure it's always proced on-hits, but I think it's a fair expectation to have assumed that Duskblade can only be activated by Shaco himself and not the clone. Nowhere that I've seen has Duskblade been classified as an on-hit spell effect, and the clone doesn't benefit from any other form of item active--including Hydra or Maw, for example. Why would people have expected the clone to activate an item passive?

Either way, it seems like a bug to me.

> [{quoted}](name=coeurloyal,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=FdhJojjU,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2016-02-16T20:13:14.460+0000)
>
> Sure it's always proced on-hits, but I think it's a fair expectation to have assumed that Duskblade can only be activated by Shaco himself and not the clone. Nowhere that I've seen has Duskblade been classified as an on-hit spell effect, and the clone doesn't benefit from any other form of item active--including Hydra or Maw, for example. Why would people have expected the clone to activate an item passive?
> 
> Either way, it seems like a bug to me.

While it doesn't proc the passive item effects, Shaco's clone DOES receive a shield from Maw/Hexdrinker if brought low enough by magic damage, and it also receives a shield from Sterak's if it takes enough burst. It also benefits from lifesteal, procs Shiv/RFC if it has enough stacks, and it also benefits from Devourer. So tbh I can see how/why it would proc Duskblade, though whether it SHOULD is another story.

That's interesting. I mostly play Shaco AP, so I've never built either of those items on him. I suppose that's what I get for assuming Maw wouldn't work on the clone if Hydra splash didn't work on it.

Regardless, the *should* is definitely the only question that matters. It likely needs to go.
Not on hit spell effect? It literally says "your next basic attack will deal bonus damage". If that isn't an on hit effect idk what is
This is scary {{champion:35}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3074}} {{item:1400}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3009}}

Im not a Shaco main so don't quote me on this but building crit on ad Shaco is bad because with his Q will always garen-T's a infinity edge ish critical hit so you will be losing damage on that critical hit because you have less ad or penetration on crit items.

It's actually the opposite.  Since his q is a guaranteed crit, it works well with IE/Shiv.  The +50% crit damage from IE makes his q hit like a truck, and the lightning from shiv does a ton of damage when modified by IE and his Q.  And most High Elo shaco players build pretty much this exact build except they havent' adopted duskblade yet.

I'm pretty sure his q doesn't get more crit damage from ie though. its stuck at the 220%. However shiv is a decent buy because the lightning will always crit for the 2x damage. 
Either way, whether or not his q is effected by ie, Maw or sterak's would be a better buy right now.
His Q dmg is increased by I.E
Still is a bad buy on shaco. Like i've said, Maw or steraks is better.

If you are ahead they I.E completes his role as an assassin/ if you are {{champion:86}} teed to win. (and wanting to troll a lil)

I don't disagree with you tho. I almost always buy Maw on Shaco :/ B then again you should be buying Maw on almost every AD in a game where they have a high burst Mage.
while I'm not certain I do believe that shaco's Q crit damage is increased by IE
well even if it is maw or steraks is still a better buy than an ie. even deadmans plate was better (not sure about now after the changes but it was).
IE isn't worth the gold it costs and actually lowers your early/mid burst compared to other items which also give Shaco a lot more utility. Shiv is fine, IE is bullshit.
You dont need that much damage to cause an overkill on shaco, he does a shit ton already.
Better overkill then not getting the kill at all ;P

That is not a good build on Shaco.

Unless you're playing against bots or something.
This is way too strong. I am betting that rito didn't see this one coming. Nerf bat inc

I've said this before when the item was up on PBE, but no one believed me. Shaco's clone allows you to do on hit passive from other items. Rageblade works on his clones too.

{{champion:83}} Can do the same. Only I don't recommend it. It doesn't particularly fit well with his typical build paths without sacrificing other things. Or least, that's how it is for me since I go {{item:3042}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3156}} + boots + beef item depending on enemy comp.

It can still be a pretty silly thing to do though since your ghost, like with Shaco clone I'm assuming, can proc Duskblade even if it's on CD for yourself. Also I think {{champion:82}} can do the same, but only if the enemy ghost has Duskblade.
My topical build for Yorick is manamune into a triforce into deadmans into zzrot into random resistance item and  cdr boots
